Learn What it takes to be a Web Developer in 2020

What would you be doing as a Front End Developer

Basic Front End Developer

  • Build Websites for indviduals & Small businesses
  • Create mobile friendly layouts
  • Create CSS animations, effects and work with CSS framework
  • Add dynamic page functionality
  • Build small client side apps with JavaScript
  • Use your browser dev tools
  • Utilize GIT, deploy and maintain small projects

Advanced Front End Developer

  • Front-End frameworks - Build powerful SPA's with better UI support
    • React - Most popular ¦ Fairly easy to learn
    • Vue - Really gaining traction ¦ Easiest to learn
    • Angular - Used in enterprises ¦ Steep learning curve
    • Svelte - JS Compiler that produces pure JS code & easy UI creation
      • Write less code
      • No virtual DOM
      • Very fast
    • Courses on Youtube
      • React Crash Course
      • Vue Crash Course
      • Angular Crash Course
      • Svelte Crash Course
  • State management - for larger apps (3rd party)
    • React - Redux, Context API Hooks
    • Vue - Vuex
    • Angular - NGRX, Services
    • Appollo Client
    • Courses on Youtube
      • Redux Crash Course
      • Vuex Crash Course
      • React context API
  • Server Side Rendering - Render React and Vue on the server rather than on client side SPA
    • NEXT - React
    • Nuxt - Vue
    • Features
      • Better SEO
      • File system routing
      • Automatic Code Splitting
      • Static Exporting
      • CSS in JS
    • Courses on Youtube
      • NEXT Crash Course
      • Nuxt Crash Course
  • Static side Generators
    • Gatsby - React
    • Gridsome - Vue
    • Features
      • Better SEO
      • File system routing
      • Data fetching from local files, during build time
      • Plugin system
      • GraphQI for Data
    • Courses on Youtube
      • Gatsby Crash Course
  • TypeScript - Superset of JavaScript
    • Static typing(vars, functions, etc)
    • Tooling Support with Intellinsense
    • Modules, Decorators, Classes
    • Compiles into Clean JS Code
    • Courses on Youtube
      • TypeScript Crash Course
      • Setup TypeScript Express

Front End Wizard

  • Familiar with a popular front end framework
  • Build advanced front-end apps/interfaces
  • Smooth front end workflow
  • Interact with backend APIs and data
  • Manage application and component level state
  • Bonus: Server Side rendering/Static site generation
